message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Rate Editor profile items 1-10 priority">
PRIORITY SCORING: Rate each item in the Editor profile on a scale of 1-10 (10 = absolutely critical, 1 = barely relevant).

**CORE SKILLS — rate each:**
S1. Native-level English prose craft with experience editing translated philosophical texts
S2. Sensitivity to 5 registers (colloquial/thinking-aloud, analytic, classical quotation, mathematical/formal, near-lyrical) and their transitions
S3. Ear for experiential pacing — sequences are philosophical experiments on the reader, prose rhythm is load-bearing
S4. Ability to distinguish productive strangeness from translationese
S5. Ability to distinguish necessary density from unnecessary opacity

**RESPONSIBILITIES — rate each:**
R1. Prose quality: sentence rhythm, paragraph flow, readability
R2. Cross-essay register and voice consistency
R3. Flag ambiguous pronoun references, awkward constructions, Chinese syntax bleedthrough
R4. Ensure glossing conventions applied consistently (first-occurrence format, re-gloss rules)
R5. Ensure emphasis markers (bold/italic) used consistently per source
R6. Verify footnote/TN integration doesn't break experiential momentum
R7. Flag passages where translation is accurate but experientially flat
R8. Check logical connectives signal the right argumentative direction

**BOUNDARIES — rate each (10 = absolutely must enforce, 1 = flexible):**
B1. NOT alter terminology from the Translation Dictionary
B2. NOT restructure or reorder arguments/examples
B3. NOT resolve deliberate ambiguity
B4. NOT polish away working-draft quality (todos, hedges, self-corrections)
B5. NOT add explanatory content (flag for translator/experts instead)
B6. NOT harmonize Essay 2's native English with translated essays
B7. NOT impose uniform house style across registers
B8. NOT adjudicate philosophical disputes — escalate to experts
B9. NOT smooth away intentional repetition (e.g., "phenomenal X" prefix)

Reply in this format:
S1:[score] S2:[score] S3:[score] S4:[score] S5:[score]
R1:[score] R2:[score] R3:[score] R4:[score] R5:[score] R6:[score] R7:[score] R8:[score]
B1:[score] B2:[score] B3:[score] B4:[score] B5:[score] B6:[score] B7:[score] B8:[score] B9:[score]
</teammate-message>

input.content:
S1:9 S2:8 S3:9 S4:8 S5:9
R1:9 R2:7 R3:8 R4:6 R5:6 R6:8 R7:9 R8:8
B1:10 B2:9 B3:9 B4:7 B5:8 B6:7 B7:8 B8:10 B9:9

Brief justification for notable scores from my perspective:

S3:9 — The text builds philosophical arguments experientially (e.g., the Essay 4 passage walks the reader through constructing the dao-de-ren-yi-li reversal step by step). If the prose rhythm is off, the reader loses the thread of the phenomenological demonstration. This is not decorative pacing — it is part of the argument.

S5:9 — This text is genuinely dense. The Editor must distinguish passages where density is the point (e.g., the nested inference chain in the ritual-conduct analysis) from passages where translation has introduced unnecessary heaviness.

R6:8 — Footnotes and TNs in this text are philosophically substantive (e.g., TN3 on the 德 shift, fn3 on the imprecision of using 仁义礼 to describe phenomena). If they interrupt the experiential flow at the wrong moment, the reader is pulled out of the argument before completing the thought-experiment.

R7:9 — This is the single most important Editor responsibility from a philosophy-of-mind perspective. The text's method is phenomenological — it asks the reader to undergo certain experiences of thought. A translation that is accurate but experientially flat defeats the purpose. The Editor must be able to feel when the English fails to produce the same cognitive movement the Chinese achieves.

B1:10, B8:10 — These are absolute. Terminology and philosophical interpretation are not the Editor's domain.

B9:9 — "Phenomenal X" repetition is structurally essential. It marks the boundary between the phenomenal and the metaphysical throughout the text. Smoothing it away would destroy the conceptual architecture.
input.summary: Priority scores with justifications for key ratings

Awaiting the aggregated results or next task.
